title: As Polygon surpasses Ethereum in this metric, where does MATIC stand - AMBCrypto News
summary: Polygon (MATIC) has surpassed Ethereum (ETH) in daily active addresses, with 399,950 users in the last 24 hours, compared to Ethereum's 376,350. This growth can be attributed to the performance of Polygon's decentralized applications (dApps) and the migration of the y00ts NFT to the Polygon network. However, Polygon's DEX volume saw a significant decline compared to other Layer 2 solutions, which had a knock-on effect on the network's total value locked (TVL) and the price of MATIC. Despite these challenges, the surge in activity on Polygon may have a positive impact on the price in the future.

title: Forks in Crypto: Hard Forks vs Soft Forks - DailyCoin
summary:
Sure, here are the main points from the article in less than 256 tokens:

* Forks in crypto are a perfect example of decentralization in action.
* A blockchain fork occurs when a new version of the network is created, with new features and rules.
* There are two types of forks: hard forks and soft forks. Hard forks are permanent and split the network into two separate chains, while soft forks are backward-compatible and do not split the network.
* Cardano's Vasil upgrade and Ethereum's Merge are examples of hard forks that improved the chain with new features.
* Forks can help blockchain networks improve, but they also pose security risks if poorly executed.
* DeFi application forks are copies of existing platforms with slight alterations.
* Historic blockchain forks include Bitcoin Cash and Bitcoin Gold, which aimed to provide more scalable alternatives to Bitcoin.
* Ethereum has undergone several hard forks, including the Ethereum Classic fork, which split the network after a historic hack.
* The Ethereum blockchain

title: Ethereum's Commodity Status Like Bitcoin Sparks Bullish Market, Dogetti Meme Coin Pre-Sale Witnesses Skyrocketing ... - Analytics Insight
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's commodity status like Bitcoin has sparked a bullish market, with Ethereum's price rising by over 4%. The CFTC has recognized Ethereum and Litecoin as commodities, similar to Bitcoin. This could lead to increased regulatory oversight and institutional investor approval, which could boost their prices. Bitcoin is also experiencing a bull market, with predictions of reaching $1 million in value within 90 days and $100,000 this year. Dogetti, a new altcoin, is gaining attention in the meme coin space and is currently in presale. Investors can purchase $DETI tokens before the official launch and potentially make a profit if the coin's value increases. (248 tokens)

title: Shiba Inu to become more decentralized than Ethereum with Shibarium onboarding thousands of billion-$-partners – Report - Crypto News Flash
summary: Shiba Inu is expected to become more decentralized than Ethereum with the launch of Shibarium, a blockchain layer that will operate on top of Ethereum. Shibarium aims to decentralize EVM node operations and provide a more secure and decentralized infrastructure for developers and dApps. Unification, the main developer of Shibarium, is working on democratizing and incentivizing EVM node operations. The project also includes Oracle of Oracles, which provides real-time asset prices by combining data from decentralized and centralized exchanges. Shiba Inu is receiving important infrastructure from Unification, and the current sentiment is bullish.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction: Pikamoon Ready to Rally 20,000% | Bitcoinist.com - Bitcoinist
summary: Ethereum price prediction for 2023 is mixed, with some experts predicting a rally to $2500 and others predicting a fall to $1800. The majority of investors in Ethereum are in profit, but the overall trend is still bearish. A new GameFi project called Pikamoon is expected to rally as high as 20,000% before the end of the year, and investors are loading up on $PIKA tokens in the ongoing presale. Pikamoon is developed by crypto experts and blockchain analysts who are fully doxxed and properly vetted, and the project has received significant community support. The Pikaverse, built on Unreal Engine 5, is expected to be a game-changer in the crypto industry.
